title: Dynamic Pole Balancing with Nonlinear MPC
oneLiner: An underactuated dynamic control system using a CasADi-based Nonlinear Model Predictive Controller to balance a free-swinging pole on a 7-DOF Franka Emika Panda robot.
problem: Balancing an unactuated pole on a high-DOF manipulator requires real-time optimal control that can handle nonlinear dynamics, underactuation, and the tight coupling between end-effector motion and pole stability.
built: Engineered a high-fidelity MuJoCo physics simulation featuring a Franka Panda manipulator with a free-hinged, unactuated pole attached to its end-effector.
Formulated the system's equations of motion using a Linear Inverted Pendulum (LIP) approximation to allow for real-time optimal control calculations.
Developed a receding-horizon Nonlinear Model Predictive Control (NMPC) solver from scratch using CasADi to compute optimal end-effector accelerations.
Implemented an Operational Space Controller (Inverse Dynamics) to map the MPC's Cartesian acceleration commands into precise joint torques across the 7-DOF arm at a 500Hz control rate.
results: Base physics simulation and unactuated joint modeling complete.
Actively tuning MPC cost function weights to balance control effort against pole angle deviation.
Next: Domain Randomization (varying pole mass and friction) to prove controller robustness for Sim-to-Real transfer.

title: VLA-Agent: Language-Conditioned Robotic Manipulation
oneLiner: An embodied AI system that translates natural language instructions into multi-step physical robotic actions using Large Language Models and constraint-based manipulation.
problem: Bridging natural language understanding and physical manipulation requires reliable grounding of abstract instructions into precise, verifiable robotic actions—with error recovery when the physical world doesn't cooperate.
built: Engineered a closed-loop tabletop physics simulation in PyBullet, featuring a 7-DOF Franka Emika Panda arm interacting with dynamically spawned objects.
Developed a robust Skills Layer of manipulation primitives (pick, place, push) handling Inverse Kinematics, joint-space motion, and constraint-based grasping.
Designed an orchestration agent bridging physical environments with LLMs (GPT-4 / Claude), building contextual scene prompts and parsing structured JSON action plans.
Implemented a feedback loop where the system verifies physical success of actions and re-prompts the LLM for error correction.
Built a production-grade codebase with an interactive CLI REPL and 176 headless tests validating everything from low-level physics to prompt construction.
results: Version 1.0 fully deployed: agent successfully executes complex multi-turn spatial reasoning tasks with reliable pick-and-place and robust error recovery.
Next: Transitioning to an in-house Agentic Training Pipeline—building a headless synthetic data generator to fine-tune a local SLM via LoRA, followed by DPO alignment.

title: Human3D — Single-Shot 3D Gaussian Splatting Engine
oneLiner: An end-to-end 3D reconstruction pipeline that converts a single 2D RGB image into a view-consistent 3D representation using differentiable Gaussian rasterization.
problem: Deterministic 2.5D point-cloud projection produces hollow, view-inconsistent reconstructions. A generative approach using 3D Gaussian Splatting with smart initialization solves the cold-start problem and produces dense, renderable 3D assets.
built: Upgraded a legacy deterministic 2.5D point-cloud projection system into a fully generative 3D Gaussian Splatting pipeline.
Leveraged the original perception stack (YOLOv8, SAM, MiDaS depth) to create clean RGB-D priors, solving the cold-start initialization problem for the Gaussians.
Engineered a PyTorch training loop from scratch featuring adaptive densification (cloning and splitting Gaussians) to resolve fine geometric details.
Integrated a differentiable GPU rasterization backend using the gsplat library, utilizing Mixed Precision (AMP) to significantly accelerate training.
results: Optimized 10K+ Gaussians in under 20 seconds on consumer hardware (RTX 3050), achieving ~26dB PSNR.
Pipeline exports binary PLY assets compatible with standard browser-based 3D splat viewers.

title: Undergrad Thesis — Non-Invasive Biomarker ML System
oneLiner: Monte Carlo photon-transport simulation + regression models for haemoglobin and glucose estimation.
problem: Non-invasive physiological estimation suffers from noisy signals and limited labeled data. This project uses physics-based simulation plus ML to predict biomarkers from spectral signals.
built: Generated synthetic optical dataset via Monte Carlo photon-transport simulations.
Built regression models (RF, MLP, SVR) for haemoglobin and glucose prediction.
Designed signal-processing + feature extraction for noisy spectral data; validated on a small experimental dataset.
results: End-to-end pipeline from simulated spectra to biomarker estimates.
Documented validation behavior and robustness limits.

title: Smart India Hackathon — Adaptive Prosthesis Control System
oneLiner: EEG-driven control pipeline with stabilised real-time servo execution for multi-gesture movements.
problem: BCI signals are noisy and unstable, but prosthetic control needs reliable commands. This system focuses on robust preprocessing and stabilised actuation.
built: Designed EEG preprocessing, artifact removal, and gesture classification pipeline.
Implemented real-time servo control for multi-gesture arm movements.
Built a stabilisation layer for noise-suppressed command execution.
results: Demonstrated reliable gesture-to-actuation mapping under noise.
